bibl.title: Report: Inventory and Inspection Report of Ambulances, March 5, 1863

div1.p: This document reviews the condition of the four horse ambulances of the 1st Division Ambulance Corp.

div1.head: Report:Inventory and Inspection Report of Ambulances, March 5, 1863
div1.p:
INVENTORY AND INSPECTION REPORT of Ambulances for which Leun't M. R. Baldwin A.A.Q.M. Reg't Div. Amb. Corps 1st Div 1st, A.C.
is responsible, and which has been inspected and reported on by John A. Knorr Leun't Col & A A G 1st Div 1st Corps

cell.unclear:
tenants written
gone
top broken and bushing

row.cell: To be turned in to Capt Pithin Depot Q.U.

div1.p:
Approved
G.R. Paul
Brig Gen Comdg Div

The above is a correct inventory of Quartermaster's Property for which I am responsible, and
which, in my opinion, requires the action of an Inspector.

M. R. Baldwin
Lt. A.A.Q.M. 1st Div. Amb. Corps
1st. A.C.

I CERTIFY that I have examined each article set forth in the Inventory hereto attached, and
its condition is as stated in the remarks opposite to it in the above Inspection Report.

STATION: Bell Plain, Va
DATE: March 5th, 1863.
John A. Knorr
Leun't Col & A.A.G.

INVENTORY AND INSPECTION REPORT
OF
Ambulances.
Pertaining to 1st Div Amb.
Corps 1st A.C.
for which Leun't M. R. Bal-
dwin in charge of Corp
is responsible.
Respectfully forwarded to the
Chief Quartermaster
Army of the Potomac
Brig. Gen. USA
J J. Dana
Lt Col & Chf of Gen
& Army Corps
40

From Mary Benjamin
1942
Item 3294 in one of her
1942 Collectors (I failed
to note which)
